intro: Persoonia arborea, commonly known as the tree-pear, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that typically grows in heathlands and coastal areas. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it has narrow, leathery leaves. Persoonia arborea is part of the Proteaceae family, which is known for its showy flowers and adapted foliage. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
